p: Risk assessments will not be accurate unless they account for the autonomous adaptation that occurs in changing climates. A significant portion of the crop modelling literature has focused on assessing adaptation options: out of 91 published studies on climate change impacts used for the IPCC AR5 ( Challinor et al., 2014b, Porter et al., 2014) about a third (33) also quantified adaptation. However, only four adaptation strategies were used in those studies, namely, changes in planting date, irrigation, crop cultivar and fertilizer. Adaptation studies therefore fail to represent the broad scope that adaptation has in the real world. Closing this gap is a significant challenge that very likely needs to involve stakeholders ( Section 6).
